# Carbone Docker
Embedded Carbone in a Docker image with simple REST API.

Many thanks to https://github.com/fleebzz for your pre-work.

## How to start the API
`docker run -p 3030:3030 rentsych/carbone-docker`

## How to consume exposed API ?
Use the JSON Endpoint `POST /render` with the following parameters:

- filename: the original filename (e.g. test.docx)
- payload: the file as base64 encoded string
- data: all dynamic parameters, which should be replaced in the document
- options: all possible options for the `carbone.render()` function (https://carbone.io/api-reference.html#carbone-render)

```json
{
    "filename": "test.odt",
    "payload": "",
    "data": {
        "title": "Carbone Docker",
        "names": [
            {
                "firstname": "firstname 1",
                "lastname": "lastname 1",
                "age": 32
            },
            {
                "firstname": "firstname 2",
                "lastname": "lastname 2",
                "age": 55
            },
            {
                "firstname": "firstname 3",
                "lastname": "lastname 3",
                "age": 46
            }
        ]
    },
    "options": {
        "convertTo": "pdf"
    }
}
```

The response will be the rendered document in the defined format as binary stream `Content-Type: application/octet-stream`.

## Example Input Document
![input.png](https://i.ibb.co/NKzmqgp/img.png)

## Barcode
You can generate barcodes using special fonts. The dynamic parameters in the document must be formatted with this font to enable the barcode feature.

### Code 39
Use the font https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Libre+Barcode+39 or https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Libre+Barcode+39+Text.

Use the function `:barcode(ean39)` in the document.

For example:

`{d.barcodeString:barcode(ean39)}`

### Code 128
Use the font https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Libre+Barcode+128 or https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Libre+Barcode+128+Text.

Use the function `:barcode(ean128)` in the document.

For example: 

`{d.barcodeString:barcode(ean128)}`

## From carbone.io website
_Fast, Simple and Powerful report generator in any format PDF, DOCX, XLSX, ODT, PPTX, ODS [, ...]_

_... using your JSON data as input._

See [carbone.io website](https://carbone.io) for full **Carbone** documentation.
